wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Gould OBE (28 June 1879 – 23 February 1971) was an English trade unionist and Labour Party politician who was Member of Parliament (MP) for Frome from 1923 to 1924 and from 1929 to 1931.  He was also the father of Sir Ronald Gould, teacher and trade unionist.

response: * Frederick Gould (1879–1971) MP for Frome, 1923–24 and 1929–31

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1929 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1923 United Kingdom general election

response: Sir Ronald Gould (9 October 1904 – 11 April 1986) was General Secretary of the National Union of Teachers in the United Kingdom from 1947–1970.  He was the son of the Labour MP Frederick Gould.

He was born in Midsomer Norton, Somerset.  His father, Frederick Gould, was a bootmakerChalk up the Memory - The autobiography of Sir Ronald Gould, published by George Philip Alexander Ltd (1976) who was later Labour MP of nearby Frome.
